data.title: The Worldfolio: Seibu Holdings Inc.
data.meta_description: Of the 12 cement factories in the group, GICA has 100 per cent ownership of seven of them. Foreign operators have a 35 per cent share of the other five, with GICA holding a controlling 65 per cent share.	Explaining the rationale behind havin…
data.text:
about this company

Vision/Mission

“Smiles ahead”

Ensuring safety and comfort is the basis of the Seibu Group’s activities, and in doing so, we strive to deliver more gratification to our customers. Under the slogan “Smiles ahead”, we aim to increase our enterprise value and to grow sustainably together with society.

Business Description

Established in 2006 as the holding company of the Seibu Group.

It has 54 business subsidiaries including Seibu Railways and Prince Hotels, and exercises corporate governance and general control over them.

With the Seibu Group Vision, we hope to make a vital contribution to safe and pleasant living for all customers and communities.

Background

17 December 2004 – Seibu Railway Co., Ltd, delisted from the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

3 February 2006 – Established, with the aim of restructuring the Seibu Group.

23 April 2014 – Relisted on the First Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

Products/Services

Urban Transportation and Regional Business

Hotel and Leisure Business

Real Estate Business

Construction Business

Hawaii Business

Other Business

Markets

One of Japan’s largest hotel and leisure chains.

Owns 466,157 square meters of land in the 23 wards of Tokyo.

Located in the northwest part of the Tokyo metropolitan area, Seibu Railway’s faultless transportation infrastructure serves approximately 1.7 million people daily.

Location

Head Office: 1-11-1 Kusunokidai Tokorozawa Saitama, Japan

Management

The Company has adopted the Corporate Audit system and has established the General Meeting of Shareholders, Board of Directors and Board of Corporate Auditors stipulated in the Companies Act as company organizations. In order to conduct proper allocation of management resources, supervision of business management and other functions as a holding company, the Board of Directors of the Company is composed of Directors who are familiar with the Group’s businesses and their management, and independent Outside Directors with extensive knowledge and insight.

Employees

22,030 employees (consolidated)

Highlights

23 April 2014

Relisted on the First Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

Other Notes

“Smiles ahead”

Bringing smiles to people’s faces by supporting the lives of customers is the value the Seibu Group provides.

We will increase our enterprise value and shareholder value by taking on the challenges of a new growth stage and working for our customers’ smiles.
